exercises.statement: Prove that $\lim_{x \to 2} x^2 = 4$ using the $\varepsilon$-$\delta$ definition.
Prove that the composition of continuous functions is continuous.

steps.title: Let $f: A \to B$ and $g: B \to C$ be continuous
steps.content: Want to show $g \circ f$ is continuous at $a \in A$.

steps.title: Use $\varepsilon$-$\delta$
steps.content: Given $\varepsilon > 0$, since $g$ is continuous at $f(a)$, there exists $\delta_1$ such that $|y - f(a)| < \delta_1 \Rightarrow |g(y) - g(f(a))| < \varepsilon$.

steps.title: Use continuity of $f$
steps.content: Since $f$ is continuous at $a$, there exists $\delta$ such that $|x - a| < \delta \Rightarrow |f(x) - f(a)| < \delta_1$.

solution.conclusion: For $|x - a| < \delta$: $|g(f(x)) - g(f(a))| < \varepsilon$. So $g \circ f$ is continuous.

exercises.statement: Use IVT to prove that $x^3 - x - 1 = 0$ has a solution in $(1, 2)$.

steps.title: Apply IVT
steps.content: Since $f(1) < 0 < f(2)$ and $f$ is continuous, there exists $c \in (1, 2)$ with $f(c) = 0$.

solution.conclusion: The equation has a root in $(1, 2)$.
